alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:03PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, southern Pulaski and northeastern McCreary Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 303 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Frazer, or 9 miles northeast of Monticello, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burnside, Quinton, General Burnside S.P. and Bronston around 310 PM EDT. Tateville around 315 PM EDT. Alpine, Sloans Valley and Greenwood around 320 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Parkers Lake, Honeybee and Mount Victory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.
